parameter.name: type
parameter.description: (Supported types: Filtering) Open the filter part of the configuration dialogue

methods.name: setColumnData
methods.description: Updates the data of a given column

methods.name: SetColumnVisibility
methods.description: Set the visibility for a certain column.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.description:
Sets the state of property «editable»
Used for «editable» binding; method is called exclusevely by the framework

methods.name: setRowData
methods.description: Updates the data of a given row

methods.name: SetRowVisibility
methods.description: Set the visibility for a certain row.

methods.name: SetStyle
methods.description: This function sets the style of the widget by calling the superclass and then processing this in the widget.

methods.name: setTableData
methods.description: This method takes data and decides wether it should redraw the entire table or just update the rows and DataTable model. An update is much faster and cost effective however can only be done if data is the only changing parameter. If anything else is changed the table has to be redrawn for the purpose of the underlaying model.

parameter.name: origin
parameter.description: id of widget that triggered this event

parameter.name: horizontalPos
parameter.description: horizontal position of click in pixel i.e '10px'

parameter.name: verticalPos
parameter.description: vertical position of click in pixel i.e '10px'

events.name: DisabledClick
events.description: Fired when disabled element is clicked on.

parameter.name: origin
parameter.description: id of widget that triggered this event

parameter.name: hasPermission
parameter.description: defines if the state is caused due to missing

parameter.name: horizontalPos
parameter.description: horizontal position of click in pixel i.e '10px'

parameter.name: verticalPos
parameter.description: vertical position of click in pixel i.e '10px' roles of the current user

events.name: EnableChanged
events.description: Fired when operability of the widget changes.

events.name: ValueChanged
events.description: Triggered when any value in the table is changed

events.name: VisibleChanged
events.description: Fired when the visibility of the widget changes.

properties.name: columnWidth
properties.description: Width of columns.

properties.name: dataOrientation
properties.description: A dataset is either placed horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: ellipsis
properties.description: If true, overflow of text is symbolized with an ellipsis. This option has no effect, if wordWrap = true.

properties.name: enable
properties.description: Initial option to enable widget.

properties.name: filterConfiguration
properties.description: Configuration for filtering entires in the table

properties.name: headerSize
properties.description: Height of rows.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description: Maximum height the Table can grow, when not set to zero

properties.name: multiLine
properties.description:
If true, more than one line is possible. Text will wrap when necessary (wordWrap=true) or at line breaks (\n).
If false, text will never wrap to the next line. The text continues on the same line.

properties.name: offsetColumn
properties.description: Index of first viewed column entry.

properties.name: offsetRow
properties.description: Index of first viewed row entry.

properties.name: permissionOperate
properties.description: restricts operability to users, which have given roles

properties.name: permissionView
properties.description: restricts visibility to users, which have given roles

properties.name: refreshRate
properties.description:
Refresh rate of how often continuously updated variables are shown in the table.
Recommanded values for the T50:
1000 cells: 1000 ms (with stopRefreshAtScroll = true)
 500 cells: 700 ms (with stopRefreshAtScroll = true)
 500 cells: 1000 ms (with stopRefreshAtScroll = false)
<250 cells: 400 ms (with stopRefreshAtScroll = true)

properties.name: rowHeight
properties.description: Height of rows.

properties.name: scrollLinkXRefId
properties.description: Reference to a second Table widget that should be synchronized for horizontal scrolling

properties.name: scrollLinkYRefId
properties.description: Reference to a second Table widget that should be synchronized for vertical scrolling

properties.name: selectedColumn
properties.description: Index of selected column.

properties.name: selectedRow
properties.description: Index of selected row.

properties.name: selection
properties.description: If true, the user can select data entries.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: Show/Hide header

properties.name: showScrollbars
properties.description: Show/Hide scrollbars

properties.name: showSortingButton
properties.description:
If true,  by clicking on a columns header will be availabe. The table will only sort on the
currently selected header. The header can be sorted in descending order (one click), ascending order
(one more click) or returned to normal state (one more click); given that you started in normal state.

properties.name: stopRefreshAtScroll
properties.description:
If set to true this parameter will stop the table from continuously updating the table while scrolling. This makes for a better
user experience, especially in the T50 and low end targets where it takes some time to reinstantiate all DOM elements - which
will interrupt the scrolling.

properties.name: style
properties.description: reference to a style for this widget type

properties.name: tableConfiguration
tooltip
properties.description: reference to a tooltip for a widget

properties.name: useTableStyling
properties.description: If false, styling can be set on the individual columns on their repsective TableItem/TableItemImageList.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: change visibility

properties.name: wordWrap
properties.description: If true, text will wrap when necessary.

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description:
The zIndex property specifies the z-order of a widget and its childs.
When widgets overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other. A widget with a larger zIndex generally covers a widget with a lower one.
The zIndex must be unique within a content.

properties.name: left
properties.description: absolute position measured from left boundary of parent container

properties.name: top
properties.description: absolute position measured from top boundary of parent container

properties.name: height
properties.description: outer height of widget

properties.name: width
properties.description: outer width of widget
